body.section:
HP Helion OpenStack® allows you to perform updates on the following parts of the Identity service configuration:
Main Keystone configuration file (/etc/keystone/keystone.conf) located on each control plane server is generated from the following template file located on a deployer: /home/stack/helion/my_cloud/config/keystone/keystone.conf.j2
Modify this template file as appropriate. Please refer to Keystone Kilo documentation for full descriptions of all settings: This is a Jinja2 template, which expects certain template variables to be set. Do not change values inside double curly quotes: {{ }}.
Once template is modified, commit the change to the local git repository, and rerun configuration processor / deployment area preparation playbooks (as suggested at Using Git for Configuration Management): $ cd ~/helion $ git checkout site $ git add my_cloud/config/keystone/keystone.conf.j2 $ git commit -m "Adjusting some parameters in keystone.conf" $ cd ~/helion/hos/ansible $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml 3. Run reconfiguration playbook in deployment area: $ cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts keystone-reconfigure.yml
